TextAsset.value: (It’s a little past “noon hundred.” Hope I’m not too late!)
Acting president Blue Max, please call to order today’s meeting of the official Namco High Military History Club!
(Ack! Hope I haven’t missed too much!)
Thank you, Secretary Blue Max. I hereby call this meeting to order. Acting President Blue Max recognizes Treasurer Blue Max.
Thank you, Acting President Blue Max. I’d like to begin with the budgetary committee report commission survey.
The numbers are in. There’s only one way to raise the neccessary funds to see SECRET PROJECT SUPER PLANE come to fruition.
Please save your applause for the end.
Now, it is the opinion of the Treasury department that cookies would provide the club with the most favorable flavor to cost to profit ratios.
I cannot present this report survey commission to the committee if I am to be interrupted! I was promised three minutes of floor time.
I, Acting President Blue Max, hereby call to recess the Military History Club pending review of new member protocols.
The Treasury objects to this course of action!
Hey, ${slot:playerName}! I was starting to think you wouldn’t show up!
Oh, you conducted a serious breach of club etiquette, but don’t worry.
I’m the club’s Acting President, Vice President, Treasurer, Adjutant, Viceroy, Ambassador, Minority Whip, Secretary of State, and Grand Royal Chancellor.
So, I can probably pull a few favors and still secure a solid 5 to 4 majority vote to get you into the club.
Wait, if you’re doing everything else, then why are you only the Acting President?
Oh, Aki Matsuo is club president, but she’s never around!
I step in and keep the club moving in her absence.
Sounds like you’ve got a lot of responsibilities around here. Is there anything left for me to do?
Of course! You can be the guy who records the minutes of every meeting.
(That sounds kind of boring, but what the heck, I like helping.)
Okay. Just be sure to record the name of everyone who speaks.
Uh, but aren’t you and I the only people here?
Yeah! So, it should be super easy for you, right?
As Acting President, I hereby bring this meeting back to a state of order.
Director of the Treasury Blue Max please continue regarding the previous motion concerning revenue shortfalls i.e. funding, re: the SECRET PROJECT SUPER PLANE.
Yes, thank you Acting President Blue Max.
You’ll note in Section 4 of the report--
Oh, ${slot:playerName}, I didn’t bring enough for everyone. You’ll have to share.
Okay. Should I write that part?

Okay, so Section 4 details potential cookie varieties via cost analysis, time table of deliverables, sales projections using the previous quarter’s national and local sales as a baseline cross-referenced with demographics.
Chocolate chip is the clear leader.
(This is awfully complicated for a report to himself!)
Max, what is all this stuff about anyway?
Tsk. Can’t you see the Treasury still has the floor, ${slot:playerName}!
This was much easier to keep track of when it was just me and the potential of Aki to maybe make it to a single club meeting.
Maybe we should designate a committee to staff a commission to draft a report on a survey of board members to cost analyze expenditures for a different hat for each club position…
Should I still be writing these parts down?
But, that’s okay! Because everything related to SECRET PROJECT SUPER PLANE ought to be kept off the record anyway.
Except you were talking about hats and not the secret project.
Ha! That’s an old accounting trick, ${slot:playerName}.
SECRET PROJECT SUPER PLANE is funded by the discretionary budget. There’s no real oversight, so all kinds of crazy unrelated programs can be funded through it using earmarks.
Yeah, it sounds like it would be.
So, you’re working on some kind of super plane then?
(It’s like he’s got a lot of energy bubbling right under the surface and waiting to burst out.)
(Uh, that sounds like it could get messy. But I mean it in a good way!)
Um, it’s called “secret project super plane.”
And then I took a wild guess?
Like, maybe, the SECRET PROJECT had something to do with a SUPER PLANE.
(It’s kind of sad that no one else is in his club. I’ve been here for five minutes and it’s crazy obvious how important this stuff is to him.)
(But he’s got no one to share it with!)
(Hmm! Maybe that’s why he’s giving me so much leeway with the protocols.)
(Uh, and I guess the industrial espionage I just accidentally did?)
It’s super important that we do it real soon though!
(Okay. Something’s sure bugging him. I’ll go along with it for now.)
Yeah, okay, Max. Lead the way.
But then DON’T ASK because we have to be quiet!
(It’s not like it’s hard to get under the table.)
Is this a security measure for talking about the secret project?
Huh. Coulda sworn Blue DORK would be in here.
Don’t you mean DORKING IT UP?
Nah, I gave it mad thought.
He’s a dork who does nerdy things.
My watch just says REVENGE on it.
Okay, they get a few minutes BUT THAT’S IT.
Let’s sit at a table while we wait.
Yeah, sitting while you wait rules! We should do that!
Let’s pick a table completely at random.
please no please no please no
The one with the TOTALLY MYSTERIOUS rattling chair!
But you know the drill. First we gotta revenge you around some.
(No wonder Max is so worried all the time!)
(He gets pushed around by these big kids every day!)
Yo, it’s not JUST lunch money.
You keep makin’ me look dumb by turning in all your homework on time!
But I don’t do my homework!
It’s filled up with doodles and schematics but definitely not anything secret or aeronautical!
If you’d just turn in nothin’ at all like a normal dumb kid, then it wouldn’t look so bad when I turn in nothin’ at all!
And then maybe I wouldn’t be stuck in detention.
So, I gotta do a revenge on ya.
Until you learn. Or until revenge stops being awesome.
Uh-oh, now you done it, Captain.
The shrimp is mad at ya.
Yeah, but the shrimp’s pretty cute. We gotta whole “will they, won’t they” thing going.
Anyway, what’cha gonna do? SHORT ME TO DEATH?
(That wasn’t a good one at all!)
We do NOT have a “will they, won’t they” thing. It’s just they won’t, uh, they.
So, why don’t you guys BUZZ OFF!
(Taira’s really a one trick pony with his insult repertoire!)
(Um, now I’m just saying crazy things!)
(There’s no way I could stop any of these guys, much less ALL OF THEM!)
You? Yeah, I don’t think so, Shorty.
Now, we don’t have time to determine who’s bullying who.
Even though that would take less time for me to figure out than explaining how we don’t have the time to figure it out.
Oh, so, what? Revenge is just a GAME to you, bro?
Yes, good thinking, King. We will not sentence anyone here to additional detention.
ON THE SINGULAR CONDITION THAT ALL OF YOU BREAK IT UP IMMEDIATELY!!!
Max, go build a model plane or something.
${slot:playerName}, I don’t know your thing yet, but go and do it quietly.
Bullies, you have like no lines of dialog, no one cares about you, just scram.
But not before I threaten the dorks with an otherwise benign phrase like, “See you LATER.”
But, for ${slot:playerName}, it could also be like a kinda TOTALLY sexy “see you later” if you play your cards right.
Yes, yes. Very good. Just get moving.
I’m glad they left us alone, but I wish Principal Dig Dug had been a little more thorough about his investigation and punishment.
Or done either of those things at all!
Yeah, that would’ve been good too.
They hardly ever bother me on the weekend…
But it’s okay! Because I’ve got the SECRET PROJECT SUPER PLANE!
And when it’s done no one will be able to push me anymore!
Um, not because of violent war plane revenge, right?
They won’t be able to push me around because I’ll be FLYING.
(Shouldn’t he be able to fly by himself?)
Well, I mean, not all the time though.
Right? Like, you’d need to refuel and use the bathroom and sleep and stuff.
Oh wow, look at the time. Military History Club is over.
Thank you. For earlier. With Taira and them.
(Even just walking down the halls, he keeps checking over his shoulder.)
(It’s a shame he has it so rough. And he keeps it all bottled up.)
(Maybe he just needs someone to help him break out of his shell so everyone else can see the sweet kid he really is.)
